descript.abstract: Urban Areas is a point theme representing major cites worldwide. Attribute information includes the name and population of the city, and indicates whether the city is a capital.
descript.purpose: For educational, non-commercial purposes. This dataset is appropriate for use in a GIS.

cntinfo.cntinst: n the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded. Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

citeinfo.origin: United Nations Dept. of Economic and Social Development, Statistical Division
citeinfo.title: 1991 Demographic Yearbook

pubinfo.publish: United Nations Dept. of Economic and Social Development, Statistical Division

procstep.procdesc:
The database contains urban settlements (a city proper or a city and its agglomeration) with populations of 100,000 or more and smaller cities that are capitals of countries and dependencies or administrative centers of selected large countries. The large countries with administrative centers (of states, provinces, oblasts, and other regions) are Russia, Kazakhstan, India, China, Canada, United States, Mexico, Australia, Brazil, and Argentina.
The population data were derived from the United Nations Demographic Yearbooks, national censuses of population, and various textual and cartographic materials.
Datasets for each continent were converted from ESRI coverage to the ESRI shapefile format using the 'copy features' tool and merged into one layer using the 'merge' tool.

cntperp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

The population of the city or urban area
The year of the population figure
Indicates whether a city is a capital.
